headline: How McCormick navigates tariffs & HHS policy changes: CEO
summary: McCormick (MKC) CEO Brendan Foley joins Opening Bid with Brian Sozzi to talk about how the spice company is navigating tariff costs. The CEO also talks about the changing landscape of the food industry, including policy changes led by Trump-nominated Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS) Robert Kennedy Jr. (RFK Jr.). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid here.

headline: Shell denies deal talks with BP, Micron reports Q3 beat: Morning Buzz
summary: The major averages were higher near noon, with the S&P 500 continuing its path towards all-time highs reached earlier this year. Meanwhile, the U.S. dollar is under pressure amid the worst first-half performance in 50 years, falling to its lowest since early 2022 amid speculation that President Trump may replace Fed Chair Powell before his term ends and markets pricing in over 60 basis points of rate cuts by year-end. headline: McCormick CEO talks about opportunities as consumers seek value
summary: More Americans are eating at home to save money. McCormick (MKC) CEO Brendan Foley joins Opening Bid with Brian Sozzi to discuss how the spice and sauce maker has maintained its outlook despite tariff and consumer spending changes. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid here.

headline: S&P Futures Gain on Trade Optimism, U.S. PCE Inflation Data in Focus
summary: September S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESU25) are trending up +0.28% this morning amid renewed optimism about trade deals, while investors await the release of the Federal Reserve’s first-line inflation gauge.
